column1: Was glad to see made in India label inside the phone. But when I saw the charger it said "made in china". Still OK. Now I thought of charging the phone a bit.. just 5 minutes after setting the new phone. As soon as I connected the charger to the socket, there was a spark and shot circuit in the charger, phone was not connected. So go disappointed. I am not returning this phone as I have already gifted it. Not sure if Amazon seller would be able to send replacement for the charger alone. Amazon never replaced the product even after multiple conversations..

Its not even one year of product purchase, and phone doesn't work well.If we want to make a call, we need to use the earphone, or else we need to put the phone in loud speaker.Back camera doesn't work.Flash light doesn't work some times.Not happy with the product.

Highly NOT RECOMMENDED While ordering I was like I'm ordering Indian make handset with patriotic feeling and expected the unexpected :(Pathetic phone, received defected peice, got it exchanged after so much hassle, again received faulty handset. If someone calls me other person can't hear me properly. They think I've put the on speaker and speaking from other room with phone in other room. So awful.

Whatever this phone might have been capable of has been completely ruined by the software on this phone and despite almost everybody calling it out to micromax, there is no hint of any improvement regarding the same.After almost an year using this phone, I would not recommend this or any other micromax phone for that matter. To what extent do we settle with this company for the sake of patriotism, atleast the Chinese are working hard and competing with apple, and here is micromax only interested in churning in money by reselling the fruit of Chinese hardwork. Great example of pathetic leadership and certainly not a company that shows any patriotism or deserves the patriotic support shown by Indians towards this company !

Got this phone delivered on 15th aug, using it for more than 15 hours now. Facing problem with battery drainage, it reduces like 20% with normal usage in less than an hour. By normal usage I mean even updating the contact details as it is new phone. Also when the phone is not in use i.e on standby it reduces 5-7% in an hours time.So 20% drainage in 1hr is really bad. Hence applying for Return.

First and foremost, I had an excellent experience shopping with Amazon and Cloudtail. My product was promptly despatched reached me within 48 hours. Also, the price at which this phone is being offered by the seller is far cheaper than the price being quoted by the sellers in my locality here in Mumbai suburbs. India Post was very quick with the delivery, and kept me well updated.As for the product, I have used Micromax A310 for the last three years without having to repair it even once in the past three years! It is still in excellent condition. So, I was absolutely stress free when I decided that I wanted another Micromax phone. So far, I absolutely love this piece for the following aspects:-high quality cameras-immersive display-loud and crystal clear sound-customizable UI-absolute smooth functioning (with no heating or hanging)-classy look and feel-the cover, protector, and all the stuff that comes in the box-those lovely in-built Micromax apps (like the alarm which rings even when the phone is off, I can never overlook these tiny blessings)There's too much to add here, but I don't have the time. So, I'll summarize it as a 'must buy.'

This is the first Micromax mobile i had bought thinking its made in india. I was bit disappointed as the pack said "make in china". The phone is good and performance so far has been great. Charge remains for a long time ... 2 + days. Camera photos are of good quality.

This product is OK OK, can't compite with China sadly, ordered because of Indian company, but it is manufacturered in China, lot of lags switching apps, lots of unwanted notification via micromax app store, can't uninstall it, OK cameras, battery backup is poor, as ram management, purchased for 9500 and now it is at 8400, within a month ,no resale as expected, it is that much annoying the notification are that I have kept it aside, can't use it it is disturbing
I have been using this phone for quite a 2 months performance is excellent battery is good No hanging or heating problem
Everything is good about this phone. Using since two months. Only problem is it hangs sometimes. And the battery is 2900 mAH which is lesser for a price of 9999

All features are best but the battery performance is awesome. I show a film which nearly about 1 hour & 45 minutes but it consume only 12% charge while for same film my redmi mobile consume nearly 35% battery. So i preferred to buy this phone. Camara and other features are also good.

I bought yureka and yuphoria almost 2-3 years ago they are from Micromax and they work well till todayComing on to the this infinity smartphone this is really value for money productI really like display and sound quality and also camera is very decentPortrait mode is only creating blur on face and this not looks like natural or DSLR look but in this price range this is very goodGood work Micromax one of best smartphone phone in this price rangeThanks to Amazon for fast deliverySome good things about Micromax canvas infinity:-Decent cameraEnough battery for 1 day useAndroid nougatFingerprint sensorGood build qualityI will give 10/10 to this

sexiest phone in the world.....Woah, this phone cannot be described in words when it comes to speed, memory etc., I loved the smoothness in working and everything is perfectThe only con i could see is rear cameraSelfie Lovers : Friends Myself Being a Selfie Lover , I Prefer This Phone Bcz At 10k Price I am Getting 16 MP Beauty Camera With Flash , Omg This Is Wonder For Selfie Lovers ............All features are best but the battery performance is awesome. I show a film which nearly about 1 hour & 45 minutes but it consume only 12% charge while for same film my redmi mobile consume nearly 35% battery. So i preferred to buy this phone. Camara and other features are also good.normal use battery 30 hoursI have been using this phone for quite a 2 months performance is excellent battery is good No hanging or heating problemCamera is superb,especially selfies are superb.Works smoothly,Batary Lasts for a day.(Moderate use).UI is NiceOverall Good phone under 10K compared to MI and Motorola Phones.I will give 10/10 to this i support indian brand go micromax go......i love this phone so much

The first time I'm writing a review.Absolutely Great device. No display issue as mentioned in some reviews. They probably don't know how to use 18:9 Ratio device. FP is fking Speedy af. Great camera. And Battery *_* 8-9hrs+ on Full time LTE Connection (Browsing.YT.FB.WA.Telegram.G+. Was using yureka 2500mAh which was giving only 3hrs of SOT on 3G. But this 1 is Awsm. 5.7 inch Infinity display gives complete new experience. If u budget is 10k - 11k then go for it. The Best MMX Device till now. LG Q6 Killer. #CanvasInfinity

Micromax is back with huge screen with small size body. Although it is a hd screen 720p due to the less bezels on all sides the display looks awesome. Thank you for the 18:9 full vision screen . The only drawback is the back camera and made in China but at this price it's the best deal and micromax also promising that the 48 hours service otherwise they will replace with a new mobile. Battery backup also good it can last for one day easily. There is no fast charging but it's taking around 90 minutes to full charge

The touch sensitivity of this phone is totally flawed. You cannot disconnect calls at times. You can'y answer calls at time. Try using the calculator. At times you press on any number, sign ... only "x" sign comes. I have used Micromax before and never experienced such discomfort with any of their phones. This one is really not a phone I would recommend to anyone.

Firstly very good phone in this price range. Bought this phone for 9000 after cashback.Good Camera quality.. Front camera is really good and selfiee lovers will like it.Decent battery back up even you use with wifi or mobile data.I am not a game lover so didnt test on playing games.Look & Feel is also good. Strong back case.Good design by micromax.Attractive feature which is full vision display.Very Moderate heating issues which is ignorable.So overall Performance wise i can give rating as 4.Few drawbacks are. No fast charging, Display light is low. Processor is not much latest and it's just quad-core but not octa core. But its okay for this price range.Undoubtedly you can go for it. Good product by Micromax.
Good brand good performance awesome experience but battery backup only 1 day!!

Happy with the phone and its build quality.....  All good but battery can be better.....  Camera is great  in this price range.... Ur can be better and some pre apps are irritating if u unnistall these apps....  After you restart  or reboot  the phone the apps came along.....  This is sometimes irritating......  Overall in this price range I suggest  you to buy this phone.....

Great device under 10k. Bought it almost 50days ago. Extremely satisfied with performance.Pros:1) Great infinity display2) Camera is quite good on both sides. Its been 1 week since i am using this phone. I am using Micromax phone for the 1st time, I really had trust issues of MM. Still went ahead and purchased after a good research. For 10K, my personal opinion is, this is a good and almost a great phone in this budget. Performance wise its good. It doesn't get heated unlike other MM (my wife uses one, Canvas) / Lenovo K5 (my last phone) models. Camera is good; does a good job. This one may not be ideal for hard-core gamer's but when it comes to a normal gamer like me, i felt phone supports the games to great extend.Only draw back i felt was the audio quality which could have been improved a little more. Bcoz i felt lot of "sound" than audio quality. Not sure is it bcoz of the standard MM headset but thats one factor which i felt a little bad. Also return policy is not a fair one as Amazon wouldnt take it back in the event of any issues. But otherwise, its a nice phone for any who has only 10K budget and looking for a decent phone.

Hi everybody I boght canvas infinity in it's 2nd sales. I bought this to encourage Indian products n to avoid China n other products. I never used any micromax phone before. This is first Indian phone I bought. Comparatively with other brands and in features, this is not good phone.Pros:Display is good, themes and colours are nice, front camera is very nice, light weight, finishing is very nice, battery life is good 6 hrs. Continuous 4g usage is successful.Con's:Slow processor, lags while switching screens even when no apps are open.Hangs frequentlyDoes't support all Indian languages properly, and some fonts.While sending SMS there is no multi contact selection.Some java programmes doesn't work.We cannot install some trading apps Luke Ventura wealth....Rear camera has no quality.Touch is slow.. My launcher is very worst, if u use other launchers like nova, noughat it works well.Dedicated apps like email, torch r missed. We can't move apps to external SD from internal memory.I think micromax didn't work welk while making this phone. Company has to release software updates to make success this phone. Otherwise patriotic people will look for other phones without nation's interest.

Review after using Micromax Infinity for more than a month.With the Chinese phones invading the Indian Market, I thought of supporting the Indian Manufacturer Micromax.I started trusting Micromax after purchasing a LED TV for a good deal.But there are 5 instances in these 2 months made me to regret for choosing Micromax Infinity. 1. The front camera response was damn slow during an office event made me embarrassing infront of others.. It took long time for processing the image. Had to hold my hand in same position after clicking the image. Sometime after 5 sec hold I took and the processed image was blurred. 2. One day, the touch screen became non-responsive and it was behaving weird. All of a sudden some random video from the Gallery will start playing. Had to remove the battery and reboot. Situation didn't repeat after that. 3. Earphones Issue : As soon as I connect my JBL earphones, it keeps on prompting for "Tap to Mute" & "Tap to Ring" not allowing me to access the Home screen or open Music app. I have to keep the music app ready before connecting earphone. 4. The Music app does not stop during Incoming call. I was riding my bike with music on from this phone. When I stopped I noticed 5 missed calls and it says it Rang 5 times and the music didn't even stopped. It was shocking for me. When connecting the headset it automatically goes to DND mode and calls are not notified. Atleast the Music should stop when the call lands your phone.. 5. The Finger print sensor is very slow and I have reposition my finger to access..Not sure all these above are tested during Phone Manufacturing.Still many Indians are ready to support Indian products please dont make them regret for their purchases.Suggestion : When I bought the 50 inch LED TV it was half the price of other big brands, I chose Micromax. When I wanted to support Micromax Infinity phone, there were many other options in the same price bracket and even lesser than 10K. Choice is yours

Revised review after 6months of usage:Phone is working absolutely fine and I am satisfied.  I got OTA update after which small hanging  problem (after data button turning ON) is gone. Good work by developers.Original review:One thing that is not mentioned anywhere is its SAR value. Its 0.294w/kg at head and 0.602 w/kg at body which is very much below accepted value of 1.6w/kg.Coming to the review: I have been using this phone from last 10-12days. Phone is good looking and performances of both camera's are good. As per other reviews already suggested go for this phone if you want general use like browsing, streaming, clicking pics & selfies :) Battery backup is satisfactory and lasts for a day with medium usage. But in return to bit lower battery capacity we get lighter and sleek looking phone :)18:9 screen size is a great USP of this phone and display is good.( I mean who goes to see PPI of the phone. 283ppi is close to retina display).Conclusion: Go for this phone without hesitation and any fear. My friends were smiling weirdly when they saw that I purchased Micromax phone. But after looking at the phone I didn't require any justification to be given to them ;) :)

Hello, I am writing this review after one month use of Micromax Canvas Infinity (Black). I bought it @ 8499/- specially because of INDIAN Brand, but it is a 'Made in China' product.NICE: Camera, Touch, Battery and Display.The phone is Good and I am happy and satisfied with my decision to buy it and its performance. The phone doesn't hang and no heating or very minor heating is observed. Camera is good in day light specially front camera though low light shots were not as nice as it should be. No blot-wares were installed during use and the phone updated three times during this time ??? (I don't know what was the update for).DISLIKE:The phone falls very short (on my expectation) on user interface, though it has a clean and simple interface. I found issues and lack of even basic features in interface though it might overcome in future updates.But the bottom line is Micromax Infinity is Good phone and will not disappoint you if you go for it, but you'll be missing some of the basis user features in its interface.

And apps get cut or shrunk due to display form factor. And at times the phone freezes. Micromax still hasn't figured out software optimization. The hardware isn't great. Snapdragon 425 is a below average CPU. Not good for gaming. Sound output via speakers are OK, but not up to mark via 3.5 mm audio jack.And 16mp front facing camera is just for sake of numbers. What will the pixels do if the optics are mediocre. I have seen many low megapixel cameras do a great job than this. Requires lot of light for good snaps.

I bought this after much research, and with some trepidation since I had never bought a Micromax product before. I was pleasantly surprised. Of course, Amazon was pretty quick in delivery. But the phone per se blew me away for the kind of price tag it came with. It packs quite a punch in almost all departments, and is real value for money. I write this after a week's usage. I use the phone largely for calling, surfing the net, messaging,  listening to music, watching videos, but not for gaming. The display may not be 100% edge-to-edge but it is far superior to those of normal phones. I bought the phone only because of the bezel-less display & I was not disappointed. Despite buyers cautioning about poor battery life and some lag, with my kind of middle-to-light usage, the battery lasts as much as 3 days. Even if you are a heavy user, I suspect it will last well over a day. There's an interesting battery-saver feature which kicks in when battery is at 15%, after that, battery lasts even longer till it dies out. The widgets may be rather small but you get used to it. Its also got the latest Android version so need for any updates. There's complete ease of use. The glass is not Gorilla and I think that's a drawback but according to me, the only one. I did play some basic games on it and there was no lag at all, despite reviewers saying so. Maybe, the lag is noticeable in the high-end games, I don't know. For the price tag it comes with, this one is quite the thing.

And the back camera is really clear at 13 mp and front camera with flash is also awesome with 16 mpNow the battery has gone down a bit in performance after almost 9 months but I have been using heavily the internet with games like ( COC, Dominations, Candy crush,etc..)and lots of software too still the battery lasts a whole day.. if under used the battery last more than a whole day almost 24 hrs and more.I have uploaded a picture taken from the rear camera to give u an idea of clarityAmazon was quick in it's delivery and I was impressed.Sound vice it lacks a punch but with headphones it's great.I love this phone for this low budget I hope it keeps going for another year.Not bad given 3 GB ram and 32 gb space inbuilt with upgrade availability to 128 gbBut the one main con is that it has no fast charge which means once fully down it takes nearly 2 hrs to get fully charged that's the one drawbackOverall Happy customer with this Indian phone lives up to the price

I am the owner of tech channel on YouTube. My channel's name is ihax.inc. you can check it out. So, I bought this phone on the first sale and I have used this product for 2 weeks i guess. First of all i would like to say that the look of this phone is amazing. It feels very handy and best to be fit in your pockets. Screen is quite impressive. I have faced some also like hearing, sometime fingerprint scanner are not working, notification light not working properly for messages and one handed mode out of 1/10 times didn't work properly. But i guess the future update these problems will be sorted out. I got a call from micromax today to tell about them the pros and cons of this phone. The split screen feature is awesome, 3 finger swipe screenshot always work properly, long screenshot feature also work well, tha cam performance is good, the cam modes are really good. Speaker quality is also good. I didn't face any lagging issues till now all the apps are working properly but sometimes Instagram crashes but this might be the problem in the app itself. For average daily use battery stays whole day after full charge but if you are constantly using the phone the battery will drain out withing 6-7hours.  At last the overall performance of this phone is  good and if you are thinking to buy this phone then surely go for it. And do check my channel on YouTube.

It's been three days now that I have used the phone. I have to say Micromax really did a good job this time by providing a high quality phone with premium looking features & better camera &  battery back up. I have used four Micromax phones till date starting from Aisha to Canvas 6 excluding this one and battery & camera features were always unsatisfactory in those compared to other similar priced smartphones.This has an excellent camera but I would prefer the 16 Megapixel camera be provided at back rather than front because I am not much of a selfie person. Battery capacity is enough to last a complete day with average usage like whatsapping, surfing & the phone does not have much of a heating issue.Call quality has also improved from previous Micromax phones and VOLTE calls are clear & sharp.Only thing I feel a little unsatisfied about is the display. After using Canvas 6 which had a DPI of 403, this one feels a little paler compared to Canvas 6 as it's DPI is around 318.But considering the price of  10000 & host of other features that is being provided, this flaw can be ignored. Those upgrading from lower end budget phones, the lower DPI will not be a flaw at all.I have provided one low light shot taken using the Super Pixel feature in rear camera to give an idea of the camera quality.

Day photography with 18:9 resolution is just cream.Timelapse really works well. I have tested 5x and 10x. Have to get some time to test 300x.Selfie is awesome. It's wide angle selfie, you  should select a good background to get a nice view selfie.Panorama is quite wide angle and covers a very good height comparable to my Moto G3. Looks very nice, does not look like photo joined unlike other phones.Phone does not heat much. No heating while internet download even on a moving vehicle.Display of the phone is bit reddish which makes videos/movie very attractive. You will enjoy.. although the resolution is 720p, but the quality is good. Pictures look sharp when you watch a movie. I have compared with Moto G3, OnePlus 5 and Yunicorn.Day to day operation is quite smooth and lag free.Using the Finger Print sensor is a charm. It instantly unlocks the screen.Battery will easily last 2 days with normal use. For me it lasts 1.5 days with moderate use of internet. Even with heavy usage you can carry throughout the day.Con: 1080p display was better for the competition, but again it needed more battery.Camera quality in low light is not impressive. But in this range I did not find better than this. Tested Xiaomi Note 4, Yunicorn and Moto G3.Build Quality could have been better. I wanted strong edges like Moto G3.Corning Gorilla glass is missing. Although it has become common in new phones still I want Gorilla glass protection.

Great phone from Micromax, Hearlty congrats to everyone who trusted and brought the phone.Likes:1. Display as promised very fine finished.2. Speaker volume is good and best .3. No heating issue over calls or while charging.4. Hi,I bought Micromax Canvas Infinity and sharing this review on my personal use.Micromax Canvas Infinity comes with a price tag of Rs. 9999/- mid range with great specs and that's the very first thing that attracts consumers.3 Things I personally like about this phone:1. Design- This phone features an infinity display which itself catches all the attention, again looking at the entire design Micromax has done a great job here giving it a slick look, feels really good and light weight in hand.2. Sim/Memory- It has a dual sim and  also supports microSD card up to 128GB. So i don't have to switch between sim and microSD card. It houses 32 GB of internal storage with 3 GB RAM, not to forget it also supports OTG which gives additional storage for your media.3. Front camera- 16 MP with a front flash has a pretty decent quality and the camera app which has inbuilt beautify modes make it more appealing.3 Things which disappoints about this phone:1. Performance- Unlocking the phone is really slow. It take its own time to unlock which after using for a while gets annoying. Switching between cameras is slow; whereas i didn't have any difficulty in switching apps. So its a mid performance phone.2. Battery- This phone has a removable battery of 2900 mAh, which I find to be not enough for heavy users even if you are only using it for internet browsing.3. Display- No full HD display.Over all, Not to forget this phone comes under Rs.10000/- and comparing it with other product I find it to be pretty impressive at this price band .My experience with this phone was pretty good.Please leave comments below if this was helpful.Thanks for reading.

This review may help people who gonna buy this mobile on 8th september :pPROS :-No Heating Problem - The best thing I love in this phone is there is no much heating, I had played some heavy games like Dungeon Hunter 5, Brothers in Arms 3, Future Fight, Mortal Kombat X etc., for more than a hour but I didn't feel much heat.Camera Quality - Camera quality(16mp front and 13mp rear both flash) is good at this price, I'm very much impressed with some effects like Portrait and Timelapse.Display - 5.7" screen with 720x1440 pixels resolution has both pros and cons. Eventhough it has 5.7" screen mobile smaller than many other 5.5" smartphonesOS - Latest Android Nougat 7.1.2, with some smart actions & smart gestures, "OK GOOGLE" works perfectly. :PFinger Print - Finger Print sensor is pretty fast than the most Lenovo and Moto phones.Charging - Charging Time is also good, it charges 2900mah battery within One and half an hour.SIM & SD Card Slot - It has 2 micro SIM slot and a dedicated SD Card slot (Upto 128GB)GPS - GPS compass is also accurate.CONS:-Portrait Games - This is an important cons, when I play portrait games (Ex: Clash Royale) the display seems to be cut on the width (this is due to 5.7" display). Not the problem for landscape games.Gaming Experience - I played Modern Combat 5 some part of games are bit laggy :(. Other games that I have listed in pros works cool.Battery - For Normal and Medium users battery will last for 1day. But for heavy users like me(crazy on gaming) it stands only for 6 - 8 hours so I listed in cons.Eventhough it has cons I gave 5star, because it is fair at this priceOTHERS:-Sound Quality - Sound quality is good and impressed with headphones (I don't like volume UI)Processor - It has 1.4GHz quad-core Qualcomm Snapdragon 425 with Adreno 303 GPU (Not the powerfull but good performance with Nougat and fair at this price)Memory - 3GB RAM and 32GB ROM (Almost or Atmost 22GB Available) which is also good.Overall Micromax Canvas Infinity is best for medium users and selfie psycho'sFinal Word for Micromax - "Keep Going! You're on right track" :)

Although I bought it from market at same price of Amazon but I am happy to write review here. Well friends, to be very Frank, spending more than 10,000 on a mobile is sheer wastage of money. Many nice phones are available in 10,000 range. Initially I opted for Nokia 5 but when I came across Micromax I found it worth in this price range with numerous features. So far no issue in this phone. This phone has everything new which high end phones provide in 50,000 range. Everything is fine except screen quality bcz screen is slightly dull and yellowish. But at this price it is acceptable. Otherwise every other feature is fine and working normally. Micromax has finally provided quality in this handset. I don't know whether it is an Indian product or Chinese but phone is awesome. It is a combination of both Samsung bezzel less and iPhone x in look wise and app icon design wise. So in end I say, Don,t waste money on expensive phones bcz money saved is money earned. Be Indian, Buy Indian.

NOTE :@ In this Review I am Explaining its Battery Performance in Detail with all possible data.@ The package includes the Screen Guard & Cover.@ Earphones included are of decent quality.@ There's Dedicated Sim slot in this Phone, so you can use both the sim cards & sd card together.@ I am uploading few Images taken from Rear Camera.I am NOT explaining the overwhelming features of this phone in Detail, which most of the other Reviewers have already explained.Just summing up Key observations, then will explain the Battery stats,Pros:1) Processor coupled with RAM is above average and handles Moderate Level multitasking easily.* Out of 3 GB RAM less than 1.7 GB is free most of the time.2) Good Call Quality and there's NO problem in signal reception.3) Display is also Awesome and similar to LG Q6.4) Internal memory is Average i.e. 32 GB, with 128 GB extendable.* Out of which only 22.31 GB is available.5) Camera Quality is Impressive compared to the price tag.6) Battery Life is above average (check the details below cons for Stats.)7) Finger Print sensor is Lightening Fast.8) Has Lots of sensor like accelerometer, gyro, compass, etc.9) Has Android Nougat out of the box.Cons:1) NO Fast Charging and charging time is very long.2) NO Image Stabilization, which gives shaky video output.3) Back is bit Slippery.4) Heats alot after 40 mins of usage.5) Ram Consumption by System apps. as usual is High.BATTERY PERFORMANCE STATS :----------------------------------------------------# Charging from 0 to 100% takes 2hrs 15mins. with stock charger.Usage Mode ---> Battery Performance(Avg.)================================================@ Mobile Data(3g/4g) Used Continously ---> 8-10 Hrs.@ Normal Calling Only + Standby ---> 18-20 Hrs.@ Normal Calling + Music Playback( Continuous ) ---> 10 Hrs.@ Internet Usage on WiFi Only( No Calling ) ---> 6-7 Hrs.@ Gaming ( Wifi) ---> 5-5.5 Hrs.@ Gaming ( without WiFi ) ---> 5-6 Hrs.@ Video Playback ---> 9-10 Hrs.--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------VERDICT:If you are fond of Larger screen to body ratio, then certainly go for it. This is good budget phone and very apt alternative to Redmi 4.But if you are avid gamer and Heavy Multi-tasker, then better invest bit more and purchase some good phone like Moto g5s plus, Redmi Note 4, etcThank You for reading this Review.

It's now 3 days I am using this phone and posting my review based on my experience for that time.The phone is nice to use and I am really satisfied for the price I paid. Amazon packing was not satisfactory but I received the phone way too fast in 2 days.I liked the phone from the very first look. Although the picture of phone on the box and website shows much less bezel as compared to actual device the phone is nice to hold despite having such a big display.Software wise I did not like the preinstalled UI at all and installed Nova launcher the 2nd day itself. Rest I can say the phone does not lag much but you can notice small delay in response if you have used better phones (obviously higher configuration and high price).On the hardware front I really liked the front camera with a selfie flash (not mentioned) the rear camera was just satisfactory. The battery is giving enough juice for more than a full day with moderate use and so I don't miss fast charging much. No heating issue at all is the prime attraction despite having a metal back. The finger print recognition is fair enough as sometimes it does not recognize the finger properly. The back feels premium although I use the back cover provided in the box (it's quite decent). The screen guard is just a waste. Head phone quality is just average. The speaker output is loud and pretty clear. 3 separate slots for 2 sim and SD card is good added benefit.So overall I would surely recommend this phone a musy buy for those who are looking a good phone in low budget.

Highlights.The Micromax Canvas Infinity has been launched at Rs. 9,999The 18:9 screen is the biggest highlight of this device .For appreciating our efforts you can buy this product from this link also. - http://amzn.to/2EoVbZFA lot of smartphone companies are now designing phones with screens that occupy their entire front surfaces, and nearly no borders. This year's most premium smartphones, including the LG G6, Samsung Galaxy S8, Galaxy S8+ and Galaxy Note 8, have all featured these taller screens. Different brands have their own buzzwords, such as LG calling its screens FullVision while Samsung uses the term Infinity Display, but they all promise more screen and less body. Thankfully, these screens are already being featured on phones at more affordable prices, such as the LG Q6 and the recently unveiled Micromax Canvas Infinity.LG's Q6 has been priced competitively to take on other phones at the Rs. 15,000 level. Micromax, on the other hand, has different aspirations, and has positioned its all-new Canvas Infinity in the sub-Rs. 10,000 segment. The company has already confirmed that there will be more models in the Canvas Infinity series.The 18:9 screen is this phone's biggest talking point but is that enough to challenge the competition? At this price level, the Canvas Infinity will have to take on some popular models including the Xiaomi Redmi 4, Nokia 5, Moto G5, and Xiaomi Redmi Note 4, all of which offer better hardware. We find out in our review.Micromax Canvas Infinity designIn terms of design, the 18:9 screen is the first thing you'll notice about the Canvas Infinity, and we did feel that this made the phone seem premium. It has rounded corners matching the exterior of the phone. However, we're confused by the official images shared by Micromax at launch time, which show a nearly bezel-less design. In reality, the phone has much thicker borders than seen in its promotional shots, and you'll notice the difference immediately. While the sides are narrow, the top and bottom are quite thick, much more than what we've seen on the premium Galaxy S8 (Review) and LG G6 (Review). Micromax claims that the 83 percent screen-to-body ratio is equivalent to that of the Galaxy S8 series.Rather than having a metal unibody, the back of this phone pops off. It has a removable battery, and dedicated slots for dual Micro-SIMs and a microSD card which is much preferable to having a hybrid dual-SIM slots like most other phones in this category. Micromax has used top-notch plastic on the Canvas Infinity, because it really doesn't feel cheap, and a lot of people around us thought it was metal at first glance. We had no problem using the phone with just one hand, and it fits well within a palm thanks to its size and rounded corners. The narrower screen and relatively thin borders make this feel like a 5.5-inch phone when it actually has a 5.7-inch screen.Like several other phones, there are lines running across the top and bottom of the rear. The power and volume buttons are on the right and are easily accessible with a thumb or forefinger. The Micro-USB port is on the bottom while the 3.5mm audio jack is on top. Much like other phones with 18:9 screens, the Canvas Infinity also uses on-screen navigation keys. The fingerprint scanner is on the back, right below the camera, and there's a Micromax logo towards the bottom. It was easy to reach even when using the phone with one hand.Despite its size and shape, this screen is also a let-down. It has a resolution of 720x1440 pixels and is an IPS panel, but its quality isn't up to the mark. In our opinion, the display on the Canvas Infinity is the least accurate in terms of colours that we have seen in the budget segment for a long time. During the review period, we noticed yellow and bluish tinges when looking at it from the sides, which was annoying. Sunlight legibility was weak as well despite the brightness being pushed up to its maximum. Considering that Micromax plans to launch more phones in the Canvas Infinity series, we hope that the company uses better quality displays. Overall, the Micromax Canvas Infinity keeps its promise of delivering an 18:9 aspect ratio screen in the budget segment, but there are severe tradeoffsInside the box, the company bundles the standard documentation, a transparent back cover, earphones, a charger, a Micro-USB cable, and the phone itself. The Canvas Infinity will be an Amazon India exclusive at launch time but will be made available offline later. Micromax sates that consumers can expect a straight replacement if it is unable to repair any problem with the phone.Micromax Canvas Infinity specifications and softwareThe Micromax Canvas Infinity is powered by a quad-core Qualcomm Snapdragon 425 SoC clocked at 1.4GHz, coupled with 3GB of RAM. This is the same processor that we've seen powering the entry-level Xiaomi Redmi 4A (Review). There's 32GB of storage which is expandable by up to 128GB using a microSD card. The phone also has a 2900mAh battery that is rated to offer talk time of 20 hours and standby time of 420 hours.At the phone's launch event, Micromax heavily promoted the Canvas Infinity's cameras. This phone sports a 16-megapixel front camera with a soft flash, f/2.0 aperture and face beauty modes. The rear camera has a 13-megapixel sensor with an LED flash and f/2.0 aperture as well. Connectivity options include 4G VoLTE, Wi-Fi b/g/n, Bluetooth, GPS, AGPS, and OTG support. There's an accelerometer and proximity, light and magnetic sensors as well.The Canvas Infinity runs on Android 7.1.2 Nougat with the company's My Launcher on top. This is the most current iteration of Nougat in the budget smartphone market right now, and Micromax co-founder Rahul Sharma has confirmed that the Canvas Infinity will be upgraded to Android 8.0 Oreo soon. Unfortunately, my Launcher manages to bury almost all important Nougat features. There are no app shortcuts, quick toggles, or revamped notifications. Only some features, such as split-screen multitasking, direct replies and quick app switching are supported. The phone uses an icon pack that mimics iOS, and the Settings app is clearly inspired by it too. We prefer the custom UI of Micromax's own Yu Yureka Black, which we reviewed few months ago.There is a plethora of bloatware including Apps Centre, Personalise, Videos, and Music, which cannot be deleted. Some of the third-party ones that can be uninstalled are the Narendra Modi, Amazon Shopping and Facebook. The Canvas Infinity is therefore a let-down in terms of software. Our recommendation would be to switch to the Pixel Launcher or use a third-party option like Nova Launcher or Yahoo Aviate.The phone supports Smart Actions which let you do things like wake up or lock the phone by double tapping the screen, flipping it to mute calls and alarms, and automatically accepting calls when you lift the phone to your ear. There are also Smart Gestures which can help launch apps quickly. You use this feature by drawing an alphabet like "O" which launches the camera. We used the Smart Gesture feature and it worked flawlessly. Micromax has also added a one-handed mode which gets enabled when sliding left or right across the navigation bar.Micromax Canvas Infinity camerasThe Micromax Canvas Infinity sports a 16-megapixel front-facing camera, which is being heavily promoted by the company. It has a soft flash, f/2.0 aperture, 5P lens, and comes with face beauty mode. The company is touting the camera's portrait mode which blurs the background similar to the bokeh effect that you can get on phones with dual cameras. Unfortunately, shots taken in portrait mode looked like they were had been Photoshopped with a heavy blur effect, and subjects seemed to have been auto-enhanced with unnatural colours. However, regular selfies were passable and showed good colours with decent amounts of detail in good light. In low-light, selfies were too dark without the soft flash.There's also a 13-megapixel rear camera with an LED flash and f/2.0 aperture. It, too, supports portrait mode though it required some amount of adjustment to get the software to apply its enhancements. Shots taken with the Canvas Infinity came out with pleasant and natural colours under good light. We got some good macro shots, and landscapes were decent. However, we found that high-contrast scenes were often underexposed, which meant a loss of detail in the shadows.When zooming in to 100 percent, the Micromax Canvas Infinity photo samples showed noise but were still passable for social media posts. Autofocus works accurately in good light though you will have to do it manually in low-light situations.Unfortunately, the low-light performance of both cameras is below par. Both the front and rear cameras need some amount of direct light around to illuminate images or they end up looking too dark with heavy noise across the entire image and minimal details.We liked the camera app on the Canvas Infinity, which had most options just one tap away. With the camera roll feature, you can take a look at the last photo you took without the need to close the main app. There's a feature called Super Pixel which takes multiple shots at the same time and combines them to give you a higher resolution and more detail. We noticed that images taken with Super Pixel were better than regular shots, though they looked a little artificial.Micromax Canvas Infinity performanceWe have reviewed several phones with the Snapdragon 425 SoC, and they have all performed decently. Unfortunately, the same cannot be said for the Micromax Canvas Infinity which was sluggish right from the start. We encountered slow responses to our touch inputs which is something we don't expect from phones at this price anymore. We also faced app crashes on the Canvas Infinity which affected usability. We blame the My Launcher UI in part for the phone's sluggish performance. It's worth noting that the phone responded better when using a third-party launchers.Thanks to the extended screen space, we found it easier to use GPS navigation and multitask with two apps simultaneously on the Canvas Infinity. No metal in the body meant that the phone didn't get too warm, which is a good thing. We used the phone extensively for watching videos and didn't feel it heating then either.We can't recommend the Canvas Infinity for gaming enthusiasts, however, as the phone stutters while playing heavy games such as Marvel: Contest of Champions and Asphalt 8: Airborne. Lighter titles like Angry Birds, Temple Run 2, and Subway Surfers were playable without any issues.The Micromax Canvas Infinity managed 36,753 in AnTuTu, 13fps in GFX Bench, 3,649 in 3D Mark Ice Storm Extreme, and 10,925 in Quadrant.Calls were clear and the bundled earphones were relatively good. Unfortunately, the speaker wasn't loud or clear enough, and its placement at the back meant that you might not hear it at all if the phone is left on a soft surface. We were able to make VoLTE (voice over LTE) calls using a Jio SIM on the Canvas Infinity. The phone, however, doesn't support direct 4G video calling, a feature being offered by Reliance Jio. Both SIMs can work on 4G networks, though only one at a time.Micromax Canvas Infinity battery lifeThe removable 2900mAh battery is claimed to deliver up to 420 hours of standby time and up to 20 hours of talk time. In reality, the phone did actually last for roughly 20 hours with heavy usage. During our review, we used the phone heavily for watching videos and streaming media, and the battery did well overall. In our standard HD video loop test, it lasted for 10 hours and 20 minutes, which is good enough for a battery of this size. There's no fast charging, and the Micromaxa Canvas Infinity took roughly two hours to charge fully.VerdictPriced at Rs. 9,999, the Micromax Canvas Infinity tries to bring an 18:9 display to the budget market. While we have to commend Micromax for trying, this phone definitely falls short in many areas. Despite the display being this phone's highlight, it is also its biggest disappointment. The My Launcher skin is buggy and performance is sluggish. If you're in the market for a sub-Rs. 10,000 Android smartphone, you should look at other options such as the Xiaomi Redmi 4 (Review), Moto G5 (Review), Nokia 5, or Xiaomi Redmi Note 4 (Review), all of which have better hardware at around the same price. If you still want a smartphone with 18:9 display just because it's something new, then you should save up some money and go for the LG Q6 (Review) instead.

Dedicated Sim slot in this Phone, so you can use both the sim cards & sd card together.@ I am uploading few Images taken from Rear Camera.I am NOT explaining the overwhelming features of this phone in LG Q6.4) Internal memory is Average i.e. 32 GB, with 128 GB extendable.* Out of which only 22.31 GB is available.5) Camera Quality is Impressive compared to the price tag.6) Battery Life is above average (check the details below cons for Stats.)7) Finger Print sensor is Lightening Fast.8) Has Lots of sensor like accelerometer, gyro, compass, etc.9) Has Android Nougat out of the box.Cons:1) NO Fast Charging and charging time is very long.2) NO Image Stabilization, which gives shaky video output.3) Back is bit Slippery.4) Heats alot after 40 mins of usage.5) Ram Consumption by System apps. Continuous ) ---> 10 Hrs.@ Internet Usage on WiFi Only( No Calling ) ---> 6-7 Hrs.@ Gaming ( Wifi) ---> 5-5.5 Hrs.@ Gaming ( without WiFi ) ---> 5-6 Hrs.@ Video Playback ---> 9-10 Hrs.--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------VERDICT:If you are fond of Larger screen to body ratio, then certainly go for it. This is good budget phone and very apt alternative to Redmi 4.But if you are avid gamer and Heavy Multi-tasker, then better invest bit more and purchase some good phone like Moto g5s plus, Redmi Note 4, etcThank You for reading this Review

To be very frank, the product looks really good and that's it. Nothing else really makes it worth buying.1. Display is huge, and as described the screen to body ratio makes it look good. But the low resolution of 720p hits the main USP of the device.2. UI is a complete Chinese crap. I don't see even a tiny bit of work that has gone into making of the UI. The whole UI design is totally inspired, you can even call it copied, by iOS. Even the tiniest of things like icons are not original. The UI is very sluggish, and I don't seem to see that Micromax is even slightly concerned with their costumers experience with their so called "COMEBACK PHONE", which is one of the main reasons I hate this phone.3. You'll some times feel that you are using a decade old phone with low performing hardware. Its feels like there is no coordination between the Snapdragon 625 and the Chinese crap UI. You'll surely not enjoy the roughness in the UI.4. Cameras are acceptable considering the price at which they are offered.5. Battery seems to be average.

I have been using this phone for last 10 days and below are my comments on this phone:Pros:1. Display is good with vibrant colors while using camera and watching videos/movies2. Battery lasts easily for a day3. Jio sim works without any issue4. Good phone in the price segment of INR. 10000/-5. Good looking phoneCons:1. Speaker output and quality could have been better2. Display brightness could have been better as visibility is poor in sun/outdoor conditions even with full brightness settings!3. Restarting the mobile takes almost 80 to 90 seconds - May be software needs fine tuning4. Audio of the videos recorded from front camera is very poor! Rear camera audio is good but lacks optical image stabilization.5. The UI could have been better. Today I got an an SMS on software upgrade/patch available but System Update doesn't reflect the same - I am unsure on how to upgrade!Apart from these, there is no clear cut details on how to get 30gb JIO offer and 375/- Kindle books free offer!Also looking for good tempered glass with back case but couldn't find one.

Performance is very good. The brand is Micromax, though comparing with other Chinese brands, the smartphone's hardware is quite good. The battery backup is awesome. Using Jio 4g 24 hrs. in 1st slot with data on all the time & Idea 3g in the other, the device is giving at about 20 hrs. of back up in average. I haven't tried any games yet. But watching movies online, listening music, browsing web & of course using facebook, what'app very heavily, the phone is running flawlessly & without any lag. Snapdragon 425 SOC is impressive. Though it is quad core processor, I haven't felt any lagging till date. It should be noted that the phone has a great camera both rear and front. The front camera has flash also and it is quite good. Last of all the display is 5.7 inches with 18:9 ratio which looks charming. The device is slim & feels premium although the back cover is made of plastic. I must tell that, nobody would regret after purchasing this one in the 10k range Indian brand.

Built quality of this phone is pretty good and battery doesnt drain easily; moderate usage will get you more than a day. but in terms of specs it still lacks behind many other brands like  xiomi, lenovo, honor, Asus etc at the price point. Also Asus phones at 9000bucks launched earlier shoots much better. what is good about this phone is that  there is no heating issue.
After 10 days screen got damaged and now Micromax saying that this not under warranty and demanding Rs. 3850 this is very bad . So I suggest all of you do not purchase this product.

I used this smartphone for couple of weeks and after using i am writing some details about this.----------------------------------Design and build quality-----------------------------------The 18:9 screen is good. it looks stylish while holding in hand. The back panel is removable means it do not have metal back panel. The look and feel at the back is good as compare to the budget. I feel some problem while removing its back panel. it is hard to remove the back panel. This phone has a 720p disply which is not full HD. After watching three movies on it and playing games the screen seems good. I tested the fingerprint sensor speed by observig the time it takes to unlock.------------------------------------Performance of the phone-------------------------------------It has snapdragon 425 processor with 32 GB of the storage. After playing 4-5 games I can say that process sir is ok. While playing Asphalt 8 and NOVA like games I feel that this phone struggle a little bit. The phone has Android nogut 7.1.2 which is the latest nuget version. The battery life of this phone is good but not the best. After charging it fully it gives me 9 hours of backup. It can vary according to your uses.-------------------------------camera --------------------------------The camera is not greatest. It does a decent job. I took some photographs in daylight condition from the back camera. The camera captures decent images. I also took some photographs in the low light condition or in night. In night the photos are not great. The photo come blurry a little bit. I took some selfies from the 16 megapixel front camera. The front camera captures quality images.-------------------------------Battery------------------------------The battery of the smartphone is average. It has 2900 MH battery. This battery can give you 9 to 10 hours of backup. Basically the battery backup depends on the uses. The battery backup reduces when you play high end games and watch movies.-------------------------------Ram management and storage--------------------------------It has 3 GB of RAM and 32 GB of internal storage. For a normal user that 32 GB storage is enough. Talking about the RAM management it has 1.5 GB of RAM free. The RAM is optimised. While multitasking it is lag free.--------------------------------Inbox content---------------------------------silicn coverscreen guardbasic cablechargerbasic earphoneuser manual

I using this phone since last 2 days. It's not good time review the product but yet I am doing mean I am excited to rate this phone..Pros:=========================Display: As advertise the main feature of this phone is it's Full Vision Display 18:9 Infinity Screen. Excellent. Since now a days this feature is trending and almost other brand eg. Vivo, LG, Samsung are trying to bring this feature into their smartphone. Micromax had did well. Gaming experience is fantastic. Playing video is also a new experience. Good job in making the display. Looks a quality product.Design: is also batter, Size of the phone is same as 5" display phone. so it best fits in the pocket. weight is also not so high.Camera:Selfie camera is awesome, you can't stop your self to have selfie when you open the camera. selfie flash is available. Image quality is also good. seconder camera is average.Fingerprint sensor: Fingerprint sensor is good. you can set it to open applications you have install. apart from locking/unlocking.Non Hybrid: Best feature. Actually I'm not getting why smartphone manufacture adding hybrid slot. Is it a feature? no it's a hassle.Battery: Removable 2900 mAh. battery is bit low capacity but yet phone last long 1 day with fair use. (eg music/gaming/surfing)Other: Got in-ear Earphone and transparent back cover. (Cheap company like MI not providing)Cons:===========Only mate Black color is availableDesign is slim so may be you it fell from your handProvided Screen Guard has no use.Overall: I was looking for this kind of budgeted phone from reputed or India brand from so long. Actually it is batter than Redmi phones. you can trust Micromax at least after this piece.Strongly Recommended

Micromax has nailed it with this phone.Looks - Phone looks great, classy black, smooth 2.5D curved glass, additional screen protector and transparent back cover is also providedDisplay - It is a gorgeous 5.7 inch display.  My phone display has a slight bluish tint and I couldn't find a way to change color calibration. Probably a software update in the future can solve  this. This Phone is increased in height, so it feels very slim and comfortable to hold.Camera - Best camera in this segment, specially the front camera. Picture quality is much better than Redmi Note 4.Performance - With SD 425 processor and android 7.1.2, it feels silky smooth for your average day work. However if you are a gamer it does lag while playing games like Subway Surfers. Don't know if it is a softaare issue or just my set has this problem.Battery - 2900 mAh battery gives you plenty of juice for a day running with average usage.Connectivity - Dual sim 4G, has a good reception, not the best, even in low signal area like inside of a building.Does not have 5GHz ac wifi capability, which is a little bummer as it is being increasingly the norm.Sound - sound output through speaker is quite loud and quality sound. So you won't miss a call. Output through headphone is also clean, much better than Redmi Note 4. You will love it.Overall, Looks is great, and adequate performance for days multitasking work, sufficient battery life, smooth near stock android Nougat experience is a plus point.
Mobile is very good in its price segment.

Very nice phone with great display. Bought it for just 9999 - 10% cash back (would come down for 9000) . My detailed review:Pro's:--Great display , it's same size of 5.5 inch phone but had 5.7 inch display.--The cheapest phone with 18:9 display till now.--Very nice UI and smooth one. Will have lot of resemblance to iOS.-- Doesn't have blotware and it pretty fast whole operating . And no heat as such for normal usage.--dedicated slot for memory card, i.e 3 slots of which 2 are for sim and 1 for memory card--removable battery, this is a good feature as if any battery issues in future can just replace it.-- front camera or selfie camera is just good--Battery performance & optimization , with just 2900 mah battery it almost coming for 1.5 to 1 day for  normal or slightly above usage respectivelyCons:--The chipset is octa core 1.4Ghz 425 Qualcomm . Could have increased the price a bit and had a better processor. Not a major con for normal use or slightly heavy use . But not a ideal one for heavy gamers and heavy users.--The one thing disappointed is the rear camera department , the photos are fine and very good in day light .  But with lot of competition from China company mobiles with dual camera setup , this is one place where micromax can improve a lot.Even if price increased by a 1000 is fine if had good dual camera with depth perception.--Battery capacity is just 2900, should have been great if had atleast 3400 or above mah . Bigger battery is always a plus with bigger screen of 5.7 inch. But can compromise on this front as not a major issue.Overall micromax had come back in style with lot of competition from China company mobiles . But if it had dual rear camera this would have been a killer phone under 10000 bucks .. the 1 star is decreased just for that

It goes without saying that the gap between phones is getting smaller and smaller. Years ago, phones would either dominate the market, or just simply be forever in the "cheap and acceptable" area for performance and quality etc.Speed and performance:I have to be honest, the performance on this handset is flawless. It is super quick, responsive and hasn't yet lagged at all or dipped in performance in the slightest. I can open the camera quickly (something that other phones struggle with if you're coming from an app), can take a photo and then go back to the app that I was in without any issues at all.Battery:This is my only negative. I have this phone meaning I have the 2900mAh battery within the handset. I am pretty heavy on my phone, and forever checking emails and texting my girlfriend (gotta make her feel loved like haha) so always using it. After starting work at around 9am and finishing at 5, I am usually down to around 20%. I don't find that things such as the camera have such a hard effect on the battery, unless you're filming in, then you start to notice a metaphorical leak so to speak.Screen:My goodness... this is my favorite part. I always thought this bezeless, or at least small bezel thing was a bit of a gimmick, but oh no. I could never go back to a phone that doesn't have this kind of display ever again. This handset, is smaller than other smart phones, but has a bigger screen. Weird, huh? Well, because the screen practically covers the entire phone size, you get a beautiful view and great clarity that is simply gorgeous. Honestly though, the screen is beautiful, I am being very serious when I say that this is the most beautiful screen I have seen on a phone before, and it has completely changed my opinion on how phones should be designed from now on.Camera:The camera is good. It offers good colour reproduction and produces sharp images. I find the video modes are good, and there are modes such as Super pixel Modes meaning you can take control of various controls on your camera. It's a shame that there isn't a dual camera setup, considering that a lot of phones are going that way, but let's be honest, if you're truly wanting to get into photography, then you're going to get yourself a DSLR. This phones camera performs excellently taking nice images and will suit the needs of the majority if not all of the people that use it. Video low light performance is a little bit average, but in well lit environments the colours are beautiful and are exceptionally well complemented by the gorgeous display.Overall:Look, this handset in my opinion is fantastic. But I genuinely think this is a change. The handset offers a beautiful, and I really do mean a beautiful design and great performance meeting many criteria and expectations. I love this phone. Honestly. I am usually so critical of phones and find it hard to settle with one, but so far, this handset is proving to be the best phone. I would definitely recommend.

An all-rounder with best in class battery life.Key Highlights:Class leading battery life, ergonomic design and compact form factor, excellent price to performance ratio, best selfie camera performance in low-light situations.Verdict:The Micromax Canvas Infinity is the best smartphone to buy under 10,000. this phone's battery life is the best thing about it. TheMicromax Canvas Infinity can easily last a full day for even the most heavy-duty user, while regular and light users can expect anything over a day and a half, or more. The camera is acceptable for this price range, while the performance is best in class as well.The Experience:The Micromax Canvas Infinity proved to be quite an ideal smartphone for anyone looking for a compact smartphone that is affordable but doesn't cut corners in a big way. Right from performance on browsing, social media apps to gaming, the phone never felt slow or out of breath. The battery performance really stands out, with almost 2 days of battery life for moderate users, you really can't ask for more from a smartphone in this price range. The device feels well made in terms of build quality and finish and it easy to use and manage. i recommend the 3GB RAM + 32GB storage (infinity) version, as it has that extra head-room for more apps and smoother multitasking. The camera is perhaps the only area where we expected more from micromax. It clicks good pictures in daylight but isn't able to hold-on to the picture quality in low-light. But then, you can't have it all!

I am writing this review after 6 months from the Purchase date.Coming from the windows phone background and since it is my first Android device :This is a fabulous device but I was a bit sceptical in the beginning whether or not should I buy it. Trust me guys this device met all the Expectations. It is obviously not a high end device but yes it did all the multitasking that I was looking for. There are usually 526 applications which are always open the background which includes WhatsApp, my email client, My Airtel App, Facebook app etc. But despite of running multiple applications this phone neither overheats no shows any sort of hanging issues.The Battery life  - the battery life is simply amazing. Uses phone bit more than average user as I'm into the client servicing profile so this phone is basically a good side kick. After full day use this phone still leaves me with 30% off battery life. For example if I charge my phone at 9 in the morning to hundred percent then this phone leaves me with 30% battery life at 9 at night which is not bad when u  talk about the battery life.The design and make of this phone is quite sleek gives a quiet premium feel when you hold in your hand. The phone is a metal body back cover which is quite durable as well. I have dropped this phone quite many times from my hand and even sometimes while it was in the charging mode, trust me there were no signs of any screen breaking or any dent in the metal body.I must tell you guys that I am not using any tempered glass for my phone, but still my phone screen sustained those drops and showed no cracks or signs. I'm just using the rubber casing, and a screen protector which came along with the phone.The cameras are  fabulous. I would say they are  doing the wonders in the low light but yes overall I would give it 8.5 out of 10.(Both front and back).Overall verdict is that this phone is rubbing shoulders with some of the high and phones in the market.I am planning to gift a new Micromax infinity phone to my wife on our anniversary.

Priced at Rs. 9,999, the Micromax Canvas Infinity tries to bring an 18:9 display to the budget market. While we have to commend Micromax for trying, this phone definitely falls short in many areas. Despite the display being this phone's highlight, it is also its biggest disappointment. The My Launcher skin is buggy and performance is sluggish. If you're in the market for a sub-Rs. 10,000 Android smartphone, you should look at other options such as the Xiaomi Redmi 4 , Moto G5 , Nokia 5, or Xiaomi Redmi Note 4 , all of which have better hardware at around the same price. If you still want a smartphone with 18:9 display just because it's something new, then you should save up some money and go for the LG Q6  instead.

Here is a detailed review of Micromax Infinity to help you make your purchase. Do leave a helpful vote :)Reasons to Buy Micromax Canvas Infinity (Pros and Advantages):1. The first reason to go with it is for the noticeably massive 5.7 inch screen. This is not the first time the company has designed a huge display device. The resolution is a bit odd for it is of 7201440 pixels which holds a pixel density of 279 ppi (pixels per inch). I wish the resolution is full HD as it will have better pixel density and clarity. Anyway the aspect ratio is 18:9 which translates to 2:1 and I would say its very tall, kind of reminds me the Galaxy S8. The brightness level seems decent with good amount of saturation and contrast levels.2. Next is that under the hood it comes with Snapdragon 425 chipset which has a 1.4 GHz Cortex-A53 CPU. Its a quad-core CPU which has the ability to process any apps without any issues. However I wish it to be an octa-core CPU but for that it will have to come with Snapdragon 625 which will eventually increase its price. You will not face any heating problems or lagging issues even multitasking continuously for longer time. Right now it is a strong competitor to the Motorola Moto E4 Plus.3. The primary memory is of 3 GB which have around 1.6 GB left after initial boot.4. The secondary memory is of 32 GB. It has about 26.2 GB left for the user. There is a memory card slot which can read up to a maximum of 128 GB. And yes it is a dedicated slot with no strings attached.5. For gaming it comes with the Adreno 508 GPU. It can run any graphic intensive apps without any kind of frame drops or lags.6. Another Micromax Canvas Infinity pros is the operating system. Out of the box it runs on Android Nougat version 7.1.2 which is the latest one. Plus the company has also specifically mentioned that it will receive future operating system upgrade to Android Oreo. Thats a huge bonus.7. The camera on the rear comes with a 13 megapixel sensor. The focal aperture is f/2.0 and it can record videos up to a maximum resolution of 1080p at 30 fps (frames per second). Secondary optics is powered by a 16 megapixel sensor which has the same focal aperture as that of the rear camera. The front camera can also record videos in full HD resolution. On both the sides there is an LED flash to deal with low light conditions. Micromax has always been in the decent zone if you ask about the camera quality. The colors, saturation, contrast and brightness are pretty decent.8. On the rear there is a fingerprint scanner which resides just below the camera. The maximum number of fingers it can register is five. It is very sensitive and also quite accurate in recognizing. Takes less than 0.3 seconds to unlock the smartphone.9. Another advantages of Micromax Canvas Infinity is that it supports USB OTG cable. You can connect flash drives and transfer files to and fro.Reasons Not to Buy Micromax Canvas Infinity (Cons, Demerits, Downsides, Disadvantages, Issues and Problems):1. The first problem or cons of Micromax Canvas Infinity is with the battery capacity. For a massive display of 5.7 inches the 2980 mAh battery is really low. I could stand if it is a Samsung or Motorola device, they have better power management algorithms as they tweaks the operating system for better performance. Also there is no fast charging feature. For a normal user its OK not to have quick charge but for avid users it is a must.2. Second disadvantages is the absence of a reputed display protection. It has neither Corning Gorilla Glass, not Asahi Dragontrail Glass. When it will break it will be shattered completely, thats the problem with standard glass protector for the display.3. Another demerits or issues is the absence of compass. How on earth they ignored the compass for the 10,000 price smartphone. Its a must otherwise turn-by-turn navigation with maps is not possible.4. And the last cons of Micromax Canvas Infinity is that it does not have the gyroscope sensor. It is important for connecting VR headsets, running augment reality applications, etc.My Verdict: If you can compromise the cons then its good to go.However, if you can increase your budget I would suggest Redmi 4A.

Great try and failed miserably.Bought this cause of its main attraction "the 18:9 display" . Except that everything is a disaster.Built and body:It's good and looks premium. Having 2.5D curved glass and no Gorilla glass leaves a worry each time I drop the phone.Software:Though the hardware specs looks decent the software UI is sluggish and hopeless. The default launcher is miserable with low amount of customisation options but also hangs whenever other launcher's are used. The surprising thing is SYSTEM UI STOPS SOMETIMES!!! Being a beta user for few apps is a pain in the neck. Almost every alternate update of any app makes the crash and make you vulnerable waiting for another update.The insane thing is Micromax diagnostics checks for crashes and already I have submitted several feedback messages but nothing seems to work (**they don't seem to care**). No OTA updates so far. (*By December 2017*)Camera:Low light camera fails in both rear and front camera. Don't consider the flash in front camera cause it's intensity is so low. No slow motion option. No EIS nor OIS. Super pixel works fine sometimes. Surprisingly front video has a lot better stabilization than back. Both front and back support 1080p videos also lot of noise alike. Daylight photography is fine. Focus on sharp detail is merely impossible how hard you try. Portrait and face beauty are clearly a diversion cause they both fail incredibly.So buy at your own risk.Buying this believing it for an genuine Indian product fooled me good.

Update after 6 months: This phone is a real value for money. I have bought a Sony Xperia xz premium and one Redmi note 5 pro for cousine. When you play YouTube hd videos simultaneously, you realise the diff is negligible. Sony I paid 55k. Photos of Redmi note 5 pro and canvas infinity are comparable(cannot compare the qualities with Sony Xperia xz premium). Audio with the stock headphones also good. No hanging issue so far. Heat is just like any other phone only. Battery is good one day even after switching on the hotspot for many hours. I am not a gamer so that part no idea, bit temple run is running flawlessly. One thing still don't know when they are releasing Oreo as thy declared during the time of launch. Overall very much satisfied what I have paid.Four days of use. Battery lasts only 8 hr medium use with Jio sim and another sim in the slot. Not much app installed. Don't know whether UC browser eats up more battery. I have stopped the notorious Micromax "App Center" notification by denying notification permission. Camera display etc are very good if you are considering the amount you have spend. Though screen display quality is not a crystal clear one but it is color rich. It would have been better if it had better sharpness. Music quality is not  good but call quality is good. So far I am satisfied with purchase for rs 8499

The OnePlus 6T is a truly great phone no matter what the price, but at half the cost of an iPhone XS with a cutting-edge in display fingerprint sensor this is the bargain buy of the year. Everybody is complaing about in-display fingerprint scanner is slow but trust me its very very very fast, phone gets unlocked as soon as your finger touches the screen and more accurate than other phones, this is the smartphone that brings all-screen design up a notch. The OnePlus 6T proves that cutting-edge technology doesnt have to cost the Earth, bringing an in-display fingerprint scanner and a tiny notch for just 37K. The gorgeous, crisp and colourful OLED display is a smidgen bigger at 6.41in, with a smaller chin at the bottom is simply amazing, coming to camera the new nightscape low light mode does a good job of eliminating hand-shake from long-exposure shots. The selfie camera is also pretty good Portrait mode works as advertised, Overall the camera on the OnePlus 6T is good and when you use the fingerprint sensor the night mode for the display is disabled temporarily and then fades back in once youve unlocked the phone. The phone comes with a screen protector already on it. the single bottom-firing speaker is loud and has a relatively large amount of bass for the phone, but is easily blocked while playing a game. OnePluss alert slider switches between silent, vibrate and ring and is still brilliant. OnePlus phones have always been good for the money, offering top specifications in well-built devices, but not pushing the boundaries of whats possible. Thats changed for the OnePlus 6T. It is pushing whats possible with the popular all-screen design using a tiny, attractive teardrop notch and a smaller chin, and its a better phone for it. But it is the introduction of a cutting-edge in-display fingerprint scanner, and making it work really well for as little as half the price of an iPhone XS, that is most impressive. theres no wireless charging, it doesnt have any of the fancy 3D face systems of some and it looks a little plain, but everything else is top notch. Even the software experience is excellent.Pros:- Good battery life, great screen, excellent performance, dual-sim, good camera, Bluetooth 5, great software, tiny notch, in-screen fingerprint sensor, alert slider, super-fast charging battery, affordable price relative to premium phones, last but not least Blazing fast softwareCons:- No notification light, glass back but no wireless charging, no expandable storage.Overall phone is excellent and it really delivers it's tagline Never Settle.Being a Amazon Prime Member Still Delivery Was Slow And Packing Is Very Poor.....

I waited for a long time for the Oneplus 6T model launch. I purchased it with lots of expectations and I am happy that it met my most of the expectations. I purchased Oneplus 6T 128gb and 6gb RAM version mirror black phone.Pros :-1) Super fast processor- can play large games without any glitch.2) Camera is super amazing. However in the night mode, the pictures are sometimes hazy. Overall it is good.3) The phone is damn beautiful. The back of the phone is simply outstanding. Notch also looks cute.4) Fingerprint sensor is working fine.5) Sound quality is good. The speakers are loud and  bass is also good. However, the company should have launched it with dual speakers. It would have been phenomenal.6) The company has increased the battery size. It gives a backup of atleast 1.5 days with normal usage.Cons:-1) NO HEADPHONE JACK. The company was making fun of Apple for removing the headphone jack, but they did the same. I just have a doubt that how will I charge my phone and watch a movie via earphones at the same time. I have to buy an external adapter which will put a dent on my pocket again.2) If I am holding my phone and have put my thumb impression as my Fingerprint phone unlock option. Then sometimes it is difficult to unlock the phone. Coz while holding the phone I have to put my thumb straight which is quite difficult.3) The night mode of the camera needs improvement.4) No dual speaker.Conclusion:It is a nice phone with brilliant specifications. It easily beats some of the high end phones of Apple , Samsung and LG and others. So you may go for it.

This device is clearly ahead of its pack for the hardware and features provided in this price range. Since everyone is well aware of the specs I'll just provide my experience while using this device.1. Sharp well balanced pictures during daytime and nightscape mode does a decent effort to reduce graininess and camera shake while taking night shots with low ISO settings. Still room for improvement though.2. As for sound quality I never use phone speakers while listening to music and prefer my Bluetooth headphones as I hate wires. I'm glad headphone jack is absent. One less vestigial organ to worry about as we move forward. Thank you oneplus. Call clarity is good as expected.3. Marriage of bloatfree oxygen os alongwith snapdragon 845 makes this phone a pure joy to use. Fast snappy and responsive! In screen fingerprint sensor though takes more time to unlock than the physical one at the back earlier, but this has been hid well by the animations provided.4. Battery life is excellent and I'm using dark theme which further reduces battery consumption. Gives me more than one day of usage without playing any games.5. Body has been exquisitely crafted and with the gorilla 6 screen and teardrop notch this is one of  the best displays you can get at present. I would have still preferred a metal unibody instead of the glass back though.All in all I would say you'd feel proud and satisfied to own this device. If you can shell out the extra dough go for the 8 gb versions. Thumbs up to Oneplus for another great product and for not "settling" !

Took the plunge and upgraded from my perfectly fine oneplus 3t. I was looking for a camera, storage and battery upgrade so 6t checks all the boxes. I miss the headphone jack as it's an inconvenience to carry that usb dongle everywhere. It comes installed with android pie and man it's buttery smooth. Thanks to oneplus community, software and user experience is something which oneplus takes very seriously. In screen Fingerprint sensor is pretty good but not quite as fast as the physical sensor. However the difference is minor.  Camera is same as oneplus 6 with some software improvements. Bigger battery makes a difference and I am getting 7 hours of SOT. A screen protector is pre-applied on the phone and comes with a silicone case in the box. Although it does the job but I would recommend to get a sturdy bumper case. No need to apply any tempered glass on the screen.Hate the fact oneplus keep on increasing the prices for every new model and I fear it might reach that flagship price 40k+ very soon.Overall I liked the phone and wish oneplus could launch it with more colors than just black.

You might find cheaper phones with similar specifications but you won't find the quality build and level of performance provided by 6T within the price range. The phone lives up to the hype. Its a true geeks companion. The huge number of settings available might overwhelm someone who is only using phones to click selfies and tiktok videos. Picture quality is undeniably good. Sound quality is amazing. Battery life extends upto 24 hours. Dash charging FTW. Power management is great. Stock OS is the best. No longer there's a NEED to flash some custom ROM unless you WANT to. In the end it all boils down to how you treat your phone. Be it any phone. Treat the device well. And let the device show you what true performance is. Money well spent.
